sect2.title: Introduction to Nail
sect2.para: The Nail package contains nail, a command-line Mail User Agent derived from Berkeley Mail which is intended to provide the functionality of the POSIX mailx command with additional support for MIME messages, IMAP (including caching), POP3, SMTP, S/MIME, message threading/sorting, scoring, and filtering. Nail is especially useful for writing scripts and batch processing.

sect2.title: Installation of Nail
sect2.para: Install Nail by running the following commands.

userinput.command: make SENDMAIL=/usr/sbin/sendmail && make PREFIX=/usr install UCBINSTALL=/usr/bin/install && ln -sf nail /usr/bin/mail && ln -sf nail /usr/bin/mailx

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: make SENDMAIL=/usr/sbin/sendmail: This changes the default MTA path of /usr/lib/sendmail.
make PREFIX=/usr install UCBINSTALL=/usr/bin/install: This changes the default installation path of /usr/local and the default install command path of /usr/ucb.

sect2.title: Contents
